diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Acute Cholecystitis, Dysphagia, Acute Blood loss anemia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute abdominal pain, leukocytosis, elevated lipase, and imaging confirmed a distended gallbladder with stones and sludge, supporting the diagnosis of gallstone pancreatitis. Additional findings include acute cholecystitis and acute blood loss anemia, indicated by a decrease in hemoglobin and positive guaiac stool.
